intro: Psychotria magnoliifolia, commonly known as the magnolia-leaved psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, shaded forest environments. Its leaves are broad and glossy, often resembling those of magnolia trees, hence its common name. Psychotria magnoliifolia is also noted for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
